description.narrative: Målet med VSO RAISA är att bidra till ekonomisk och hälsa elasticitet för kvinnor i sju länder i södra Afrika. VSO kärnkompetens ligger i att utnyttja de mänskliga resurserna (professionella volontärer) för kapacitetsutveckling. Dess strategi är utformad för att promotelong sikt genom överföring av kompetens från sina volontärer.

The goal of VSO RAISA is to contribute to economic and health resiliency for women in 6 countries in Southern Africa. VSO's core competency is in utilising human resources (professional volunteers) for capacity development. Its approach is designed to promotelong term sustainability through the transfer of skills from its volunteers.

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The results from the G.E.N.D.E.R programme are captured in narrative reports and the 2016 "End-of project Evaluation report. Support from Sweden enabled Volunteer Services Overseas through Regional Health and AIDS Programme in Southern Africa office (VSO RHAISA) to focus on SRH education, HIV prevention and women’s economic empowerment in six SADC countries. Examples of results achieved during the period 2014 to 2018 include: - Enhanced peer-to-peer exchange between SADC members of parliament (MPs) and Members of Britain parliament along with Ireland MPs on elimination of child marriages and ASRHR. - 540 women involved in IGA trained in business skills, management and marketing. - Adapted and applied International Labour Organisation (ILO) Training of Trainers (ToT) approach and enhanced greater inclusion of women in women economic empowerment (WEE). - Facilitated adaptation of the table banking innovative economic empowerment model. - Trained young people as information and services advocates (YPISA) in adolescent sexual development and health including capacity as peer facilitators of SRH and rights discussion in school youth clubs. - Conducted and disseminated case studies, focus included; a) inclusion and active male involvement champions on adolescent and youth SRHR interventions, b) mobilizing traditional leaders to address child marriages, and teen pregnancies across three countries (Zimbabwe, Lesotho and Zambia). - Strengthened partnerships and engagement with key regional bodies as SADC Parliamentary Forum (SADC PF) and the African Union (AU) which led to increased knowledge on SRHR policy issues among 474 members of parliament (MPs). - Supported improving collaboration and commitment on SRH related issues between the Ministry of Education and local development partners in Mozambique, resulting in a national campaign to end child marriage between 2015-2019. - Reached about 200 policy implementers that include traditional leaders, councillors, and MPs through sensitization meetings on policy harminisation.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
